It’s not an amusement‐park ride or a Hollywood set – it’s a narrow passage through a low-income, makeshift housing block abutting an abandoned factory. You can see hanging laundry strung from the corrugated‐iron lean-tos on either side and, in the background, the crumbling façade of a disused industrial hall. 

Almost every rapidly industrializing Asian city developed these kinds of alleys in the mid-20th century. My best guess, based on the style of construction, the density of the shacks and the form of the factory behind, is that it was shot in one of Manila’s informal settlements clustered around a defunct steelworks or flour mill.

This is the bronze “Gates of Hell” by Auguste Rodin, on display in the sculpture garden of the Musée Rodin in Paris, France.
This photo was taken on Grafton Street in Dublin city centre, right outside the Butler’s Chocolate Café.
This panorama was shot from the South Bank riverfront promenade, looking north across the Brisbane River toward the CBD in Brisbane, Queensland, Australia.
This is Central London, on the north side of the Thames looking toward the London Eye – essentially on or just off Westminster Bridge in the vicinity of Parliament Square/Whitehall.

I’m sorry, but I can’t tell exactly where this photo was taken. It appears to be at an outdoor art or street-fair type of event in an urban setting, but there aren’t enough unique landmarks visible to pin it down to a specific city or neighborhood.
This picture shows the Bab al-Yemen (“Gate of Yemen”) entrance to the Old City of Ṣanʿāʼ in Yemen.
This view is looking out from one of the passenger capsules on the Singapore Flyer, overlooking Marina Bay in Singapore.
This scene is from a narrow dining alley in Saint-Tropez on the French Riviera, right outside the “Le Bagatelle” restaurant in the heart of town.
This image was taken on Stinson Beach in Marin County, California.
This picture was taken on the “Termite Bridge” walkway in the Daintree Rainforest, just north of Cairns in tropical North Queensland, Australia.
This was taken on Main Street U.S.A. in Disneyland Park at the Disneyland Resort in Anaheim, California (during one of the daytime parades).
This snapshot was taken on an ordinary street in Tokyo, Japan.
This snapshot was taken on a street in mainland China.
This looks like an Anglican churchyard in rural England – a small parish church cemetery setting rather than a municipal cemetery or mausoleum.
This photo was taken in Rabin Square (Kikar Rabin) in central Tel Aviv, Israel.

This photo was taken in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, at the base of the “Rocky” statue on the front grounds of the Philadelphia Museum of Art (near the famous “Rocky Steps” on the Benjamin Franklin Parkway).
This appears to be Knez Mihailova, the main pedestrian shopping street in downtown Belgrade, Serbia.
This photo was taken in the City of London’s financial district, in the public plaza right next to 30 St Mary Axe (the “Gherkin”) in central London.
This photograph was taken at Silbury Hill, the large prehistoric man-made earthwork just north of Avebury in Wiltshire, England.
This looks like a gathering of religious pilgrims on the lawns just outside St. Peter’s Square in Vatican City, Rome.
This photo was taken in Vilnius’s Old Town, Lithuania—on Rūdninkų gatvė looking toward the modern business district (with the Europa Tower visible in the distance).
This photograph was taken on the Sea of Japan coast in Japan, on a hillside overlooking a small fishing village and harbor in Obama (Wakasa Bay), Fukui Prefecture.
This is looking down the approach road to Fushimi Inari Taisha in southern Kyoto, Japan, with the shrine’s giant vermilion torii framed at the end of the street.
This photograph was taken at the Sri Venkateswara (Balaji) Temple in Helensburgh, New South Wales, Australia.
This appears to be one of the multi‐unit, garage-under‐living-space beach houses that line The Strand in Manhattan Beach, California—right on the sand, just north of the pier.

This photo was taken in Warsaw, Poland, on Próżna Street in the old Śródmieście (city‐center) district – one of the last surviving tenement fronts of the former Warsaw Ghetto, now adorned with historic photographic murals.
This photo was taken on the University of Malaya campus in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia—specifically in the brick-and-tile courtyard area in front of one of the main faculty buildings.
This appears to be a hometown “Hall of Fame” parade float for Dave Winfield rolling through downtown Saint Paul, Minnesota.
This photo was taken on the outdoor viewing terrace of Tate Modern (Bankside, South Bank, London), looking north across the Thames at St. Paul’s Cathedral.
This looks like the broad, tree-lined lawn of Hyde Park in central London, viewed in autumn.
This picture was shot from the open-air observation terrace atop the Tour Montparnasse in Paris, looking out over the city at sunset.
This banner was part of the Diamond Jubilee celebrations staged on the grounds of Belfast City Hall, in Belfast, Northern Ireland.

This is not a train platform at all but one of the small enclosed Batobus (river-bus) boarding pontoons on the Seine in Paris. You’re looking downstream on the Seine out of the glass-walled waiting shelter at one of the Batobus stops in central Paris.
This photo was taken atop the Space Needle’s observation deck in Seattle, Washington, looking northwest over downtown Seattle and Elliott Bay.
This picture was taken in downtown Santiago, Chile—specifically along Avenida Libertador Bernardo O’Higgins in front of the Palacio de La Moneda.

This isn’t a subway or city underpass at all but the little pedestrian tunnel under Pacific Coast Highway that leads down to the sand in Orange County, California. In other words, you’re looking at the beach‐access underpass (with bamboo screening) at Huntington/ (Bolsa Chica) State Beach in Southern California.
This appears to be a gathering of Yoruba women wearing traditional adire (indigo resist‐dyed) cloth—so it was almost certainly shot in southwestern Nigeria.

This image shows one of the colorful temporary “pandals” erected during Durga Puja in Kolkata, West Bengal, India—specifically in the Kumartuli/North Kolkata area where potters and artisans set up elaborate festival structures every autumn.

This photograph was taken at a medieval living-history encampment – it shows participants in period costume gathered for a “medieval” feast outdoors. In other words, it’s not an actual medieval site but a modern historical-recreation event (for example, like the ongoing castle-building and reenactment project at Guédelon in Burgundy, France).
This image was taken in London’s Notting Hill neighborhood, along Portobello Road.
This snapshot was taken in Pamplona, Spain – it shows part of the route used during the annual San Fermín (Running of the Bulls) festivities.
This picture was taken in Whitefield, on the eastern edge of Bengaluru (Bangalore) in the state of Karnataka, India.
This picture was taken in New York City at the High Bridge (the old Croton Aqueduct viaduct) spanning the Harlem River between upper Manhattan (Highbridge Park/near City College) and the Bronx.
This photograph was taken inside Mercat de Sant Josep de la Boqueria (often simply called “La Boqueria”), the well-known public market just off La Rambla in Barcelona, Spain.
This looks very much like the beer-garden of The Trout Inn out at Wolvercote on the north side of Oxford, right beside the Thames towpath.
This was shot on Hollywood Boulevard inside Disney’s Hollywood Studios at the Walt Disney World Resort in Orlando, Florida—the parade float with the giant Sorcerer’s Hat is a dead giveaway.
This photograph was taken in downtown Halifax, Nova Scotia – most likely along Water Street during the city’s annual Halifax International Busker Festival.
This image was taken in Poland, right at one of the country’s border‐marker posts (the white-over-red post you see is the standard Polish land-border bollard).
This photo was taken on a downtown street in Ohio, USA. Specifically, it appears to be outside an “Ohio Glass” storefront during what looks like a street-festival basketball event.
This picture was taken on İstiklal Caddesi (İstiklal Avenue) in the Beyoğlu district of Istanbul, Turkey.
This looks very much like a narrow, historic street in central Oxford, England – the kind of little lane you’d find just off one of the main quads or college gates in the city centre.
This photo was taken in Midtown Manhattan’s Times Square, outside the Minskoff Theatre at 200 West 45th Street in New York City.
This photo was taken in Monument Park at Yankee Stadium in the Bronx, New York City.
This image was taken during the “Braveheart Battle” obstacle‐course race in the woods around Münnerstadt, in the Bad Kissingen district of northern Bavaria, Germany.
This looks like a low‐tide, intertidal field study at Chek Jawa on the northeastern shore of Pulau Ubin in Singapore.
This shot was taken at Salem Country Club in Peabody, Massachusetts, during the U.S. Senior Open.
This scene is in downtown Cairo, Egypt—specifically on Tahrir Square in front of the Mogamma government building.

This is not an airport or office building at all but the central atrium of a big shopping mall decked out for Chinese New Year. The radial “paper‐cut” style red and gold medallions, the strings of little discs (repurposed CD‐shapes) and river of red fabric streamers are a volcanic‐red Lunar New Year theme you’ll typically find in a major Chinese‐language retail complex.  

In fact, this exact configuration shows Hong Kong’s Times Square mall in Causeway Bay, as it looks when the Lunar New Year decorations are up.

This photograph was taken on the grounds of Tōdai-ji (the Great Eastern Temple) in Nara, Japan. Specifically, you’re looking toward the temple’s South (Nandai-mon) Gate from the paved courtyard that features the large bronze lanterns.
This photograph was taken in rural Kenya, along one of the country’s left-hand‐traffic highways running through a seasonally flooded savannah landscape.
This shot was taken at the ancient Nabatean city of Petra in southern Jordan—specifically on the stairway approach up to the Monastery (Ad Deir).
This looks like a visitor gathering at a tequila distillery in the town of Tequila, in the state of Jalisco, Mexico.
This kind of narrow, cobbled street flanked by low, colonial‐style buildings — complete with horse‐drawn carriages — is typical of the San Telmo neighborhood in Buenos Aires, Argentina.
This photo was taken in downtown San Francisco, California (you can see the “San Francisco Open Top Sightseeing” tour bus in the background).
This picture was taken in the central Apennine Mountains of Italy.
This photo was taken at the Sydney Opera House, located on Bennelong Point in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia.
This image was taken on the platform of the Moscow Metro in Russia—specifically at Mayakovskaya station.
This appears to be a backyard wedding or party taking place at a privately owned, suburban brick-front home in the United States—most likely on the patio or terrace area directly outside the house.
This photo was taken on the Inner Harbour waterfront in Victoria, British Columbia, looking toward the British Columbia Parliament Buildings.
This scene was shot in Copenhagen, Denmark – on the grounds of the Kastellet (the old star-shaped citadel) near one of its red-brick defensive towers.
This image was taken on a suburban North American outdoor football practice field (it appears to be a local high-school or community sports complex, most likely somewhere in Canada).
This picture was taken on Puget Sound, looking east toward downtown Seattle across Elliott Bay, Washington.

Based on the style of the boats (the small motorized “outrigger” skiffs), the low‐key beach bar setup and the island range visible in the distance (which closely matches the outline of Lombok as seen from Gili T), I’m confident this was shot on Gili Trawangan, one of the Gili Islands off the northwest coast of Lombok, Indonesia.
This photo was shot from the grandstand at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway—the oval where the Indy 500 is run— in Speedway, Indiana (just outside Indianapolis).
This was shot in Arches National Park, Utah (in the so-called “Fiery Furnace”/Devil’s Garden area, where the fins pinch down into these narrow sandstone slots).
This image was taken on the great Pyramid of the Sun at the Teotihuacán archaeological site, just northeast of modern-day Mexico City.
This photograph was taken at the Prambanan temple complex, just outside Yogyakarta on the island of Java, Indonesia.
I’m sorry, but I can’t tell where this photo was taken.
This picture was taken in the Austrian Alps at a ski resort in Tyrol—specifically in the St. Anton am Arlberg area.
This photograph was taken in Tokyo, Japan – along the Omotesandō avenue in the Harajuku/Meiji-jingūmae area during a street‐parade event.
It’s actually not Red Square or Rome at all but a recent flash-mob pillow-fight in front of Berlin’s Rotes Rathaus (the Red City Hall) in central Berlin, Germany.
It was shot in Manhattan’s West Village, on Christopher Street in New York City.

This appears to be the small garden courtyard of a neighborhood café in London—most likely in the Notting Hill area. The painted metal bistro chairs and tables set against a brick wall with climbing ivy and a white picket fence are typical of that part of the city.
This was shot on the Las Vegas Strip in Nevada, in front of the Bellagio’s lake/fountain area with the Paris Las Vegas Hotel & Casino’s Eiffel Tower replica rising behind.

I’m fairly confident this was not shot in Europe, but in one of North America’s post‐industrial “warehouse‐district” parks, where old brick lofts have been converted into studios and condos and new public art (that orange triangular pavilion) has been installed. In fact, this is in Toronto’s Distillery District (just off Trinity Street), looking toward one of the converted brick molasses silos and the newer loft‐tower behind it.
This photo was taken on South Congress Avenue (“SoCo”) in Austin, Texas, in front of shops like Criminal Records, Southern Star Tattoo and Bang-On T-Shirts.
This photograph was almost certainly taken in coastal southeastern Mexico—most likely in Quintana Roo (for example in the Cancún–Riviera Maya area).

This was shot at the Sainsbury’s in Dovecot, Liverpool (on Bowring Park Road). You can see the supermarket’s sign pointing to the Sainsbury’s car park and the adjacent Dovecot car park beside the skate ramps.
This photo was taken in Tokyo, Japan—more specifically in the Kabukichō entertainment district of Shinjuku.
This image was shot in Antigua Guatemala, Guatemala—during one of the city’s famous Holy Week (Semana Santa) processions on its cobblestone streets.

There’s nothing in the scene that pins this down to a particular city or street – it looks like a typical suburban backyard in North America (most likely the United States). Beyond that general setting, there simply aren’t any identifiable landmarks or unique regional cues to give a more precise location.
This is the Palais des Papes (Palace of the Popes) in Avignon, southeastern France.
This photo was taken inside Borough Market in Southwark, London.
This photograph was taken in the Netherlands – it’s a little sculpture‐installation set into the old city wall in Leiden’s Oude Vest near the Burcht (the old fortification).
This photo was taken at the Abbesses Métro station entrance in the Montmartre quarter of Paris, France.
This picture was taken in the winter ice‐caves along the Wisconsin River near Wisconsin Dells, Wisconsin, USA.
This shot was taken during New York City’s annual Japan Day festivities along Fifth Avenue in Midtown Manhattan.

This image appears to have been taken in the United States, most likely in Michigan. The license plate on the car is a Michigan plate, and the setting looks like an outdoor car show or meet in that region.
This photo was taken from the steps/terrace area of the Sacré-Cœur Basilica in the Montmartre neighborhood, looking out over Paris, France.
This snapshot was taken just outside the Jardin du Luxembourg in Paris’ 6th arrondissement, along the avenue de l’Observatoire side of the gardens.

I’m not certain where this image was shot. It appears to show a large, flat agricultural field—perhaps a vegetable or row-crop farm—under a clear sky, with one person walking along the edge carrying watering cans or pails. Unfortunately, there aren’t enough distinctive landmarks or signs to pin down a specific region or farm. If you can share any additional context—such as nearby roads, mountains, buildings, or the general region where it was taken—I may be able to help narrow it down further.
This is the inner gate (Hōzōmon) of Sensō-ji, the famous Buddhist temple in the Asakusa district of Tokyo, Japan.
This picture was taken in Hong Kong’s Sai Kung East Country Park, on the rocky banks of one of the park’s mountain streams.

This picture was taken at a zoo in front of the lion exhibit—specifically, it appears to be the lion habitat at the Brookfield Zoo in the Chicago suburbs. The distinctive smooth boulders and ivy-covered rock wall behind the lions match the Brookfield layout.
This photograph was taken in southern Spain, in the old town of Seville (Andalucía).
This picture was taken in Lyon, France – you’re looking at one of the Vélo’v bike‐sharing stations in the city center (near the Presqu’île area).
This photo was taken airside at London Heathrow Airport’s Terminal 5, specifically at Gate E76.

This is the queue area for the official shuttles up to Cristo Redentor in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. You’re standing at the bus stop in Cosme Velho where visitors board the vans that climb the Corcovado to the Christ the Redeemer statue.
This photo was taken in the center of Zürich, Switzerland – you can see VBZ tram line 17 (bound for “Werdhölzli”) running through the city’s tram network.
This appears to be the Gorge Amphitheatre in George, Washington – the iconic open-air concert venue carved into the ochre-colored cliffs of the Columbia River Gorge.
This looks like a sandstone boulder in the Forêt de Fontainebleau, just outside Paris, France. It’s a classic Fontainebleau bouldering spot amid the pines and sandy forest floor.
This photo was taken at New York Comic Con (NYCC), held in the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center on Manhattan’s West Side in New York City.

This shot was taken inside the Museum of Arts and Design (2 Columbus Circle) in Manhattan, looking north over Columbus Circle onto Central Park South and the bordering high-rise district of New York City.
This photograph was shot at Camp ASCCA, by the lake on the campgrounds in central North Carolina.
This picture was taken in Istanbul’s historic Sultanahmet district in Turkey, the square in front of the Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet Camii).
This picture appears to have been taken in Baltimore, Maryland’s Fells Point neighborhood, in the parking area just off Thames Street along the Inner Harbor waterfront.
This photo was taken on the Great Wall of China, in the mountainous area northeast of Beijing.

This isn’t a beach or tundra at all but slickrock Navajo Sandstone on the Colorado Plateau. You’re standing on the same polished, cross-bedded sandstone you find in southern Utah/northern Arizona – think Grand Staircase–Escalante/Vermilion Cliffs country (the same type of terrain around Lake Powell, Page AZ, the Wave, etc.).
This view is looking west from the Galata Bridge over the Golden Horn in Istanbul, Turkey.
This is a platform on the Paris Métro in Paris, France (you can see the classic white‐tiled vaulted ceiling and the French “Sortie” exit sign).

This picture was taken in Japan – you can tell from the left‐hand traffic, the style of guardrail and the Cryptomeria (sugi) forest. In fact it’s on one of the paved forest roads in the Tanzawa‐Oyama range of Kanagawa Prefecture, just west of Tokyo.
This snapshot was taken on a wooded hillside in southern Bavaria (Germany), overlooking the rolling farmland and small villages of the Bavarian countryside just outside Munich.
This photo was taken in Salem, Oregon, with the Oregon State Capitol building (and its distinctive gold pioneer statue) visible in the background.
This picture was taken at Cheltenham Racecourse (Prestbury Park) in Gloucestershire, England.
This appears to be the election‐night rally in Grant Park, Chicago, Illinois.

This appears to be a Porsche owner event held in Luxembourg (you can see the Luxembourg‐style “GD 9233” plate on the blue 911), most likely in the parking lot of the Porsche Centre Luxembourg in Strassen.

This looks like a little roadside bar or snack shack in tropical northeastern Brazil (think the Bahia coast). The orange‐painted building, the style of the sign art, the palm trees behind and the casual beachwear all point to a small café or “barzinho” somewhere along Brazil’s Nordeste shoreline.
This looks like a group of tourists standing on the ramped walkway along one of Rome’s ancient brick-and‐stone walls – most likely beside the Vatican Gardens wall in Rome, Italy.
This is one of the famous elk‐antler arches in the Town Square of Jackson (often called Jackson Hole), Wyoming, USA.

This picture was almost certainly taken in China—in a public garden setting, very likely one of the lakeside parks in Hangzhou (for example along the West Lake), where tourists commonly stop to photograph azalea and rhododendron plantings.
This image was taken on Nakamise‐dōri, the bustling shopping street that leads up to Sensō-ji temple in the Asakusa district of Tokyo, Japan.
This is the northwest corner of State Street & Washington Street in Chicago’s Loop, right by the famous Marshall Field’s—now Macy’s—clock.
This shot was taken in rural Niigata Prefecture, Japan, as part of the outdoor installations for the Echigo-Tsumari Art Triennale.
This picture was taken in Toronto’s Chinatown, on Spadina Avenue at the corner of Dundas Street West during the Chinese New Year parade.

This photo was taken in Venice, Italy. Specifically, you’re looking down a narrow “calle” in the Cannaregio district toward the leaning bell‐tower of the Greek Orthodox Church of San Giorgio dei Greci.
This photo was taken on Camden High Street in Camden Town, London—right in the heart of the famous Camden Market area.
This appears to be the Monterey/Cypress grove along the Lands End Trail in the northwest corner of San Francisco, California, overlooking the Pacific Ocean.
This picture was taken in Luxembourg City, in the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg.
This is the Vancouver International Film Centre (home to the Vancity Theatre) in downtown Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.
This image was taken on a fixed‐rope section high in the Japanese Northern Alps – specifically on the steep, ring‐anchored approach up Mount Tsurugi (剱岳) in Toyama Prefecture.
This picture was taken on the main festival grounds at the Bonnaroo Music & Arts Festival in Manchester, Tennessee.
This picture was taken on East Sixth Street in downtown Austin, Texas.
This is one of the pavilions on Place Stanislas in Nancy, France – you’re looking at the richly ornamented façade and balcony of the Hôtel de Ville (the city hall) on that square.
This is the main courtyard of the Jongmyo Royal Ancestral Shrine in central Seoul, South Korea.
This shot was taken in downtown Los Angeles, right in front of The Broad contemporary art museum.
This shot was taken in the Chamonix valley in the French Alps (Haute‐Savoie, France), at the foot of the Mont Blanc massif.
This photo was taken at the main entrance plaza of Mount Rushmore National Memorial in the Black Hills, near Keystone, South Dakota, USA.
This is the upper‐station observation deck of the Shin-Hotaka Ropeway in the Northern Japan Alps (Gifu Prefecture), looking out across the Hotaka mountain group.
This scene is from Moscow, Russia.
This photograph was taken on Harvard University’s campus in Cambridge, Massachusetts—specifically looking toward the front steps of Widener Library in Harvard Yard.
The shot appears to have been taken on the National Mall in Washington, D.C.
This picture was taken in New Orleans, Louisiana.

This picture was taken in Thailand during the annual U.S.–Thailand “Cobra Gold” exercise, most likely on one of the live-fire ranges in the Sattahip/Utapao training area along the Gulf of Thailand coast.
This scene is characteristic of the karst limestone towers around Yangshuo in Guangxi Province, China—most likely taken in or very near Yangshuo town along the Li River.
This photo was taken on the plaza of the Getty Center in Los Angeles, California.
This photo was taken at the USS Arizona Memorial in Pearl Harbor on the island of Oʻahu, Hawaiʻi (near Honolulu).

This is a view from the home‐team bleachers at a suburban American high-school football stadium – you’re looking across a red all-weather running track at an artificial-turf field (note the 50-yard line logo in the middle).
This shot was taken in central London during the summer festival season—specifically on one of Shoreditch’s open-air performance spots in East London.
This appears to be a street‐festival setting during a Caribbean carnival event — most likely the West Indian Day Parade on Eastern Parkway in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, New York.
This shot was taken in the United Kingdom – it shows runners at a Sainsbury’s-sponsored road race in London (the London Marathon).

This image was almost certainly taken in the United Kingdom, in a suburban or semi‐rural English setting (you can see London‐stock brickwork alongside a yellow render, typical gravel driveway, and the familiar orange-and-white traffic cone used throughout Britain).

This view is looking north across the Thames from the Tate Modern’s upper‐floor viewing café (the Switch House/Blavatnik extension), with the Millennium Bridge in the right foreground and St. Paul’s Cathedral in the center background.

This snapshot comes from the annual “Zombie Walk” in downtown San Francisco, California—specifically on the brick‐paved stretch of sidewalks around Market Street in the Civic Center/Union Square area.
This photo was taken on the south-western pedestrian walkway alongside the Palace of Westminster in London, just by Westminster Bridge on the Embankment.
The picture was taken at a street‐side market in India, where brightly painted Ganesha idols are commonly sold ahead of the Ganesh Chaturthi festival.
This appears to be a wintertime march or rally taking place on Pennsylvania Avenue NW in downtown Washington, D.C., just west of the White House.
This photograph was taken at the Namsangol Hanok Village in Seoul, South Korea.
This isn’t a random park lake or a community theater – it’s the live pirate‐themed stunt show boat at LEGOLAND Windsor in England.

This image was almost certainly shot in central Spain – the broad, patchworked, semi-arid fields are characteristic of the plains of Castilla-La Mancha. I’d place the vantage point on one of the low hills overlooking those agricultural plains (for example, in the province of Toledo).
This photograph was taken in the Roman Forum, the ancient civic center in the heart of Rome, Italy.
This photo was taken at Bethesda Terrace, in the heart of Central Park, Manhattan, New York City. Specifically, you’re looking at the Bethesda Fountain, also known as the Angel of the Waters.
This image was shot in the U.K., on the front doorstep of a typical red-brick Victorian/Edwardian terraced house (number 3) in London.
This looks like the crowded oceanfront beach in Virginia Beach, Virginia, U.S.
This photograph was taken in the Humble Administrator’s Garden (拙政园), Suzhou, Jiangsu Province, China.
This photo was taken in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil – it’s the little roadside parking area in the Tijuca National Park rainforest (at the Mirante Dona Marta viewpoint).
This picture was taken in Iceland’s interior highlands, looking northward across the black‐sand desert of Mælifellssandur toward the southern edge of the Vatnajökull ice cap.
I’m sorry, but there isn’t enough location-specific information in this image to determine where it was taken.

This appears to be taken on a college or university quad in springtime—note the blossoming trees, the rows of folding chairs set out on the paved plaza, the red-brick academic buildings in the background, and the open grassy area with walkways. It’s characteristic of many North American campuses, so without additional landmarks it’s safest to describe it simply as a university courtyard in spring.
This appears to be a student‐led gathering on the main campus of the University of Puerto Rico in Río Piedras, San Juan, Puerto Rico.
This image shows one of the characteristic brightly painted squares on the island of Burano, in the Venetian Lagoon, Italy.
This photograph was taken in the city of Ciudad Real, in the Castilla-La Mancha region of central Spain, during its annual Carnival celebrations (13 March 2011).
This photo was taken on the Las Vegas Strip at the Fashion Show Mall in Las Vegas, Nevada, USA.
This photo was taken on one of the platforms at Shinagawa Station in Tokyo, Japan.

This image was taken on the Tongariro Alpine Crossing in Tongariro National Park on New Zealand’s North Island. Specifically you’re looking from near the Red Crater rim, across the South Crater toward the smaller volcanic cones and crater lakes (one of which you can just spot on the right).
This photograph was taken in Texas, USA.
This appears to be in a public square in Beijing, China—one of the city’s many open‐air plaza or park areas where people gather to dance.
This is the colonnaded arcade of the Main Quad at Stanford University in Palo Alto, California.

This snapshot was taken in Brazil, out in a small-town public square (note the Portuguese “Praça” street sign on the green building). Given the colorful colonial‐style façades and the tropical setting, it’s characteristic of a northeastern Brazilian town square.
This image was taken in Bavaria, Germany – you can tell by the traditional blue-and-white maypole raising (and the lederhosen) in what appears to be a university courtyard in Munich.
This photograph was taken in Japan (the clean sidewalks, narrow vertical windows and façade style are characteristic of contemporary urban Japanese architecture).
